titles.title: A bill to establish a trust fund using civil penalties collected under the Occupational Health and Safety Act of 1970 to compensate victims of the collapse of the L'Ambiance Plaza in Bridgeport, Connecticut.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.
Committee on Labor and Human Resources requested executive comment from Labor Department.

calendar.text: Committee on Labor and Human Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Labor and Human Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Kennedy without amendment. With written report No. 100-551. Additional views filed.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 998.

bill.summary: 2/24/1988--Introduced. Establishes a trust fund using civil penalties collected under the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970 to compensate victims of the collapse of the L'Ambiance Plaza in Bridgeport, Connecticut.
